website_summaries.verdict: While it has some quality issues, many satisfied customers love its compact size and small price – the one to choose if your budget is your top concern.
pros: With 200 watts of power, clear sound, and a compact design, it has a lot to offer for a budget-priced receiver
cons: Though it has Bluetooth capabilities, the connection range isn't very long

customer_reviews.title: Resist the urge to by this small cheap amp - you are better off with a used receiver off of craigslist
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES ! A REAL "PYLE "OF JUNK Please listen to the warnings here folks. This one died 9 days after my return period - sound stopped. Resist the urge to by this small cheap amp - you are better off with a used receiver off of craigslist. Zero recourse for me now as I need to have this in play before the 4th of july celebration and that will push me towards another product for sure. A real PYLE of junk !
customer_reviews.author: StarChildSkull

customer_reviews.title: Strong Stereo Receiver - Great Price - Packs a PUNCH!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding little receiver. There are only two speaker "out" connections, but the device generates enough power that I just spliced two speaker wires together and connected a total of four stereo speakers. The Bluetooth range is limited (weak signal) as noted in other reviews and the power light is very bright. There is an FM tuner in the unit and it's a little clunky to set up - but it works fine with the included external FM antenna. However, the key criteria for me were price and delivery - it was a bargain at under $90 and delivers powerful sound. I'd definitely buy it again and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: HOODsters

customer_reviews.title: Not at all happy with the product or the service
customer_reviews.text: I would never purchase this product or any product from Pyle again. The bluetooth range on this receiver is about 6 feet from the device. When I called the representative said this was not normal performance for this product. I went through the hassle of filling out paperwork to return and paid $23 to ship it to Pyle. The representative and e-mail from Pyle said they would either replace or repair. They returned it with a check list marked "Nothing wrong with the unit. Please check your installation." First, it is not the installation. Second, they should have said that on the phone. Not at all happy with the product or the service.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Hill

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: the volume control on the remote does nothing, I sent the unit back to Pyle, it came back in the same shape and the Pyle support team tried to tell me it was a analog vs digital issue, a load of of it trying to get around poorly designed amp. a word of warning, when using the remote and hitting the power, it only shuts off the words on the display the display never shuts off, the amp is always on and the only way to silence it to change the inputs, and the amp is still on
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty terrible Bluetooth - AUX is almost as bad
customer_reviews.text: I've tried to get this thing setup in a way where I would enjoy listening to music with it - but literally every input on it has some sort of issue. There's clicking on the Aux input - mics have similar issue. I've tried different speakers, different outputs, all the same issues. Bluetooth has a lot of degradation no matter what I use to connect to it - my iPhone can literally be sitting right next to it, and it still has a ton of degradation listening to Spotify (not noticeable through headphones). I've given this a solid go for about a year trying different connections and ways to improve the listening experience, and it's just bad.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Haddy

customer_reviews.title: VERY disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have called these people SEVERAL times. My receiver will NOT receive FM; just static. No antenna provided. Bought one myself. Still just static. Their customer service is a joke. ALL their people are impossible to understand; heavy URDU all over their English. Asked for an English FIRST language service person. Transferred to CEO, who transferred me to a man I could finally understand. He took my complaint and my phone number, with the promise to call me back. NEVER did. I Get vague emails from another service person who is never able to provide technical help. I could NOT be more dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Williams

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - cheap materials and bad bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the bluetooth connectivity from phone (Pixel 2) and was disappointed that from direct line of sight maybe 10' max away it was dropping out regularly. Overall the "build" of the unit just felt kinda cheap. I owned a smaller, non-bluetooth unit that I loved, but the push button speaker post connections in the back broke because they were cheap. This unit has threaded (better) speaker posts, but that was the only thing I felt better about it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, couple quirks
customer_reviews.text: All in all not bad for the price, the remote is limited in what it can actually do and is setup weirdly. Also the remote CAN'T turn the unit completely on or off. You have to use the button on the unit then the remote "power" button basically puts the unit into "sleep" mode, all the led lights stay on but the screen and music turn off. From the remote you can't change input source either so you can't go from watching a movie with the audio over your stereo to listening to music without adjusting the dial on the receiver. Sound quality is great and well amplified so far (I still have more speakers to connect)
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: For the 1st 5 months I was Impressed and then........
customer_reviews.text: For the money paid I thought it was a fairly nice unit for the price but after 5 months the amplifier in the unit blew out. Other than a blown amplifier everything else works fine but with no amp you get no sound, a total waste of my money, will not purchase any Pyle product in the future. This is the 1st negative review I have ever done after years and years of purchasing products online and hopefully it will be the last.
customer_reviews.author: Don In Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 11 days of using it in the garage to power the bluetooth setup....
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pyle receiver and they are cheap and get the job done. First received lives outside and had been for the past 4 years. This one will get the inside treatment; its nice to be able to listen to FM radio also. Bluetooth has to be enabled but a quick read in the manual will do it. Looking forward to putting the amplifier through its paces! Edit: Had ordered this on 4th of April and it broke on the 18th of April. Not sure whats going on with Pyle quality; lets see how long the replacement will last. If it goes out also its time to find another vendor.
customer_reviews.author: sceneIT?

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth range is about 3 feet
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I liked this unit, but the bluetooth range was terrible. At the suggestion of Pyle tech support I returned the unit for a replacement, but not much improvement. Oddly, it seemed to work ok with an iPhone, but not with Samsung. I had the unit in a closet and lost reception as soon as I stepped out it faded out. I put a bluetooth speaker right next to the unit and walked all over the house and the speaker worked just fine so it wasn't a problem with my phone. I have since replaced the unit with another brand, in the same location it works great.
customer_reviews.author: joespringer19

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT: THE PRODUCT'S QUALITY BORDERS ON BEING A SCAM!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this piece of CRAP in late April of 2019 and it QUIT WORKING in late January of 2020. I think a stereo/receiver that only lasts for 10 months would be well below anyone's lowest expectations. To get this POS fixed, I must pay shipping to NY from TX and then return shipping from NY back to TX. OH, did I mention that I have give them my credit card number for the REPAIRS and return shipping. MUST BE NICE TO HAVE A BUSINESS THAT BEARS NOT FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE SHODDY PRODUCT IT PRODUCES.
customer_reviews.author: roy frost

customer_reviews.title: Died Within 6 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: I should have know this would be an awful product based on it's cheap price. It went completely dead just 6 weeks after buying it. I didn't expect the sound to be the best, which it wasn't - there was a lot of background noise at higher volumes. And the controls were very cheap feeling - which I also expected for the price. But I did expect it to do what I bought it for - simply transmit music from my computer to my speakers. It couldn't do that, even though I never drove it hard. It was never turned up to more than 25% of it's rated power, yet it still fried in a short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Wainscott

customer_reviews.title: Bought two...both broke within 30 days of use.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to work for my sons. The first one we bought had a broken folder track knob. We returned it to Amazon and got a different one. We've had this second one for less than a week and now the sound is really distorted. It sounded at first like Bluetooth interference, but it is happening on all the different sources. If the volume is below 1/4 it is not too bad, but past that it sounds horrible. There is no other product on the market that can do what this can, but apparently this can't even do what it claims. I'm so bummed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 28 year old pioneer receiver that had every option on it. Now a days I just just wanted something that I could run my spotify and t.v. through but would also power Cerwin Vega At15's. This amp definitely does all three quite well. For the price I couldn't beat the results. As for the bluetooth connectivity I've had no problems moving my phone away until I get over 30' away or down into the basement bathroom with a floor and two walls in between them. This is the 2nd Pyle equipment I've bought the other one is a surround speaker four years ago and it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ferocious

customer_reviews.title: It’s just okay
customer_reviews.text: Lots and lots of features for the money, but it’s not a well designed amplifier. The controls are just weird but it’s nice and heavy which is a sign of quality in electronics. I’m not sure did buy it again after trying it out, but I don’t regret buying it either. In conclusion, it’s just okay.
customer_reviews.author: SSteacher95

customer_reviews.title: FM Radio Defective
customer_reviews.text: The FM radio presets set themselves when I went to the radio mode and I cannot change them. I also cannot change the station. The buttons only change you to the next preset station and back. So its worthless to me. I've left messages with Pyle about it, no response. Based on other reviews on the topic, high return cost and lack of confidence in the company making it right, I'm just resolved to living with the defect. If the FM radio is important DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. The bluetooth and sound system work great.
customer_reviews.author: C Wesley Jones

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase so far. I purchased this item for some small Pyle speakers that I bought previously and I am so happy with the outcome. As a full-time RVer, I wasn't able to hear anything through my TV's speakers when my AC kicked on so I knew I had to add something to it. I bought the speakers first (Pyle PCB4BK) and when I realized they weren't just going to plug into the back of my TV, I had to start looking for a receiver. I was leery about the purchase but those two items together are phenomenal. So much output that I haven't had ANY issues and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: sandalwood217

customer_reviews.title: It has crapped out in about 10 months. Warranty is bogus.
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to work okay. Had lot of issues with remote functionality and such. Since it was inexpensive, I overlooked those things. BUT, now it started making rattling sounds. Even though it is under warranty, it'll cost about $35 to send it in and return shipping. So, it is going into garbage. Even if you send it in, what is the probability that they'll actually fix before sending it back. More often than not, such problems are marked "not reproducible" and I'll be out another $35. Star rating is also partly fake.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Twain

customer_reviews.title: This is a Pyle all right.
customer_reviews.text: This unit's bluetooth leaves a ton to be desired. I primarily purchased this unit for the built in bluetooth. It is spotty at best. No matter how close you are to the unit or not. It is constantly cutting in and out. The overall sound and power of this unit are questionable too. I really was hoping this Pyle unit would perform much better. It connects well to bluetooth units but just is constantly dropping the signal.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Sexter

customer_reviews.title: Price is perfect and I ordered it and less than 24 hrs later Fedex delivered it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received This little unit and am absolutely astonished at how great it sounds paired with a pair of JVC Sp-mxkb30 bookshelves speakers that I purchased at Goodwill for $3.99 each So for less than $70.00 total I have the perfect man cave solution I don’t have I tunes so I’m just streaming from YouTube and other free sources and We are absolutely impressed by all of its functions.. Don’t hesitate to purchase I’m getting another one for our Mercedes Benz Sprinter Winnebago Vita moter home this thing is packed with features from Bluetooth fm radio surrounded sound karaoke with the double mic inputs it’s a no brainer great job guys we are now repeat customers
customer_reviews.author: roosh

customer_reviews.title: Good garage amp
customer_reviews.text: I put this amp in my garage and have it powering my polk outdoor speakers. The sound is nice and the amp can easily push the speakers. The blue tooth reception is not really strong, but if I keep my phone near the amp and don't move it I have little interference. Having my phone in my pocket and walking around in the garage is not good. The display is a very bright blue color so I wouldn't want to keep this in a living room or somewhere you want darkness.
customer_reviews.author: Don Quixote

customer_reviews.title: Great but had issues. Hate to see it go
customer_reviews.text: Would have been 5 stars across the board but had issues with it. First off, I love the compact design. Connects easily to Bluetooth devices, sounds great. Had mine about a month and one of the speaker channels quit working. I hate to even return it but quality is kind of bad. Has tons of usable features. Really wish it would have been a longer relationship. I’d say it’s worth the asking price all day long but I unfortunately will have to move onto a little better product
customer_reviews.author: Kawa

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but chose to return it because one of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great but chose to return it because one of the indicator lights was badly chipped. I expect manufacturers to look at their products before shipping them. And I usually return them when damaged, even slightly. Another reviewer stated that the knobs were not marked with pointers, but if you look closely there is a very small notch on each button so you know where it is pointing. I do agree that the blue display and blue indicator lights are way, way too bright. Maybe they designed it for people who wear sunglasses inside or need a very bright night light. For the price, I will be happy to get a non-damaged replacement and will cover the lights with something.
customer_reviews.author: Roger A.

customer_reviews.title: Pyle packs a lot of good into a small and reasonably priced unit
customer_reviews.text: I began using Pyle products almost 10 years ago and have never had any issues with them. This amp was purchased to upgrade my exsisting Pyle amp to include Bluetooth capability. I initially has this unit in my garage powering Bose 301 speakers but have moved it to power my Bose 151SE outdoor speakers. The Bluetooth range has not been an issue being outside 20-30 feet from the unit (located inside). The sound is as near perfect as my ear can tell with no distortions. I have plans to purchase another to "re-upgrade" the Pyle amp I had in the garage for those speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Worked well while it still worked
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an inexpensive garage receiver for two speakers. It worked well for about a year and then the right channel started acting up. I thought it was a loose connection and now that channel stopped working all together. It is not a high quality receiver, but I was hoping to get more than a year out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh C

customer_reviews.title: Great little receiver/amp.
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this amp two days ago and installed it to my system today. I purchased it for my built in ceiling speakers in the dining room and patio. The unit worked so well and sounded so good I decided to hook it up to my main theater system. I used the audio out of this unit connected to the AVI INPUT on my home entertainment receiver. I can now play all of my iTunes library through my HIGH END theater speakers using blue tooth. This is a great little unit for the money. One last thing, the blue power on LED is very bright, I cut a small piece of black electrical tape and covered the LED.
customer_reviews.author: Valley  Bob

customer_reviews.title: poor sound control and useless remote
customer_reviews.text: i thought this would be a great amp i could use to hook up multiple devices and control remotely. the sound quality is fine but the volume is very loud, it goes from very loud to medium sound and then completely off, there is no in between for softer volume. Also remote doesnt do a thing. I'd stay away from this, i thought I could get away with a cheap amp but ended up with a sony (i also considered yamaha). just get the more expensive and trust brands if youre going to do it right, saves you the headache.
customer_reviews.author: PolarBear

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small amplifier
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this amazing receiver after buying a pair of in wall speakers. I was looking for something small that I could hide in a kitchen cabinet or easily mount out of sight. Nearly everything I saw was both HUGE and expensive. Then I found this beauty. Not only is it under $100, it is now mounted between two cabinets. It looks awesome. It pushes my 100w 8 ohm polk audio speakers like they were made for each other. The Bluetooth function was great as well. I was able to return an adapter I had purchased and saved $30. Now my echo show has a nice little setup in the kitchen. I couldn’t have planned it better.
customer_reviews.author: BashyMcNasty

customer_reviews.title: No volume control for line inputs
customer_reviews.text: This unit would be awesome for the price, but for some reason manufacturer decided that one will never need to adjust sound of their DVD system via remote - so you can't. Volume adjustment works for bluetooth or radio and probably for MP3, but it doesn't work for any of the line inputs (EVD, DVD and Aux), which renders unit fairly useless for me as I needed it first of all to be an amp for my TV set. Too bad, because otherwise it would be quite a nice unit for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Pyle PDA6BU 200 Watt Bluetooth Stereo Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to replace an old Kenwood Amp from many years ago. The unit seems to be well constructed and offers features consistent with those advertised. The unit sets up easy and provides loud, clear sound. It is nice that it includes an FM receiver, MP3 player and external input. I have the unit connected to a Blue-ray player and external HD radio and it functions well. I did test the Bluetooth function and it operates but I've not tested it extensively yet. The remote does operate but doesn't switch audio sources. It it did, this would be a superior product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brannon

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs now, but BlueTooth was a problem if that's what you need
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars if it wasn't for the BlueTooth range - I expected it to be able to reach 30-40', but it really struggled at 25-30'. This was annoying since I really wanted the connectivity. Since then a better option for what I wanted that didn't need to use BT to the Pyle came along. So I am using the other inputs / outputs and it is all working great. I guess another small nit is that the remote likes to be line of sight, and it's not intuitive to use. I'm fixing that by integrating it with a Harmony hub, so I think it will work out nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Great little amp/receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great little amp/receiver! Blue tooth works well and playing music from an SD card also works well. I don't use the radio feature so not sure how ell this works. My only complaint is the volume control is not very linear at the lower volumes. The volume control knob turns in steps and from one step to the other is either louder than I would like or too quiet. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: DFP

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit and I am not a compensated reviewer
customer_reviews.text: Great Unit and I am not a compensated reviewer, I need to state that because I have been disappointed with reviews of things in the past that had high reviews and were not that great. This unit which does have problems like stated on other reviews, like the remote doesn't have full control, and sometimes the bluetooth reception is not the greatest. However you can't beat the price and if you pair the unit with big speakers you can push a decent amount of sound out of it with the proper size speaker wire.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Burrow

customer_reviews.title: Volume Control & Speaker Channel Issues are unresolved
customer_reviews.text: There are serious issues with this product in the areas of Volume Control and the use of certain input devices via both RCA cables & the Aux port. My experience: (a) If the volume control dial is turned more than quarter way clockwise, I get a loud clicking sound coming from the Pyle and my speakers produce a stuttered/choppy output (b) when either my Tuner and Tape Deck is attached via RCA or Aux, the Pyle output comes through ONLY ONE CHANNEL ! After several weeks, Pyle Technical Support are still unable to provide or recommend a solution. Will have to ditch this product and buy a reliable brand - a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Rad

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice.  Go with a Yamaha R-S202BL instead
customer_reviews.text: This device works, but it is not ready for prime time. Bluetooth is very weak. The remote is very weak. Can't even control volume other than the dial on the front. I replaced it with a $119 Yamaha R-S202BL that blows the Pyle away.
customer_reviews.author: PopThinks

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: Should have went with my gut feeling after reading all the negative reviews on this product. The speaker wire connection points dont exist regarding securing the speaker wires in the back of the receiver. The remote is a joke and is almost useless ! The blue tooth is also appears to be a last minute un thought addition that does not connect well unless your are within less than a foot from the receiver. Overall...... this unit is not even worth the fairly priced level it is sold for. Would NOT recommend this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Travel -n- Treats

customer_reviews.title: Heavy feedback, poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I'd say you get what you pay for, but there are good amps out there for comparable pricing that don't have the issues Pyle has. I had one Pyle amp that was OK, but went bonkers on me after 18 months or so. I replaced it with this one, but the ever-present hum and popping on bluetooth input made me send this one back. I ordered a Fosi amp that's the size of a deck of cards for almost the same price. None of the Pyle issues.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter T.

customer_reviews.title: Volume knob does not wotk in BT or FM mode while using the rca outputs.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to have some tunes in my garage, overall it is pretty crappy. The big giant volume knob does absolutely nothing when in BT or FM radio mode. When you power it up the radio or BT mode comes on at full volume every time, and the only way to turn it down is with the janky little remote. If u loose the remote you will have to use your phone to control the BT volume and i guess you would be forced to listen to FM radio at full volume also.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Griswold

customer_reviews.title: Pyle Amp quit after 15 months.
customer_reviews.text: As much as I liked this at first, it quit working after one year and 3 months. It just stopped playing anything through the speaker outlets. Granted it was used a lot in 15 months; at least once or twice a day, but it started just cutting off sound at random times about a month ago. It was used to power outdoor speakers for my Echo dot. I'm glad I kept my old stereo amp to replace it. It worked solidly for a little more than a year at least.
customer_reviews.author: CERyan

customer_reviews.title: It's A Great Little Amp!
customer_reviews.text: i got this little amplifier a couple of days ago and I'm blown away by how nice it really is. I hooked it up for surround sound with my smart tv in just a few minutes, and it works great! I was pleasantly surprised by it's build quality, and the sound!
customer_reviews.author: R. Lehman

customer_reviews.title: It is a good looking small unit that was advertised to do everything ...
customer_reviews.text: I so wanted this to work, I tried twice. It is a good looking small unit that was advertised to do everything I wanted. The first unit input worked well just NO output to the speakers. I returned it and exchanged for a second. The second unit the display was inoperative right out of the box. I hooked it up anyway the remote control did not work. but it had output to my speakers. It worked for less than 5 minutes and the speakers output quit, never to be heard from again. disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Becker

customer_reviews.title: Cool, but lacking connective options
customer_reviews.text: I planned to use it as a Power amp for my Stereo System although I found it lacking in it’s Connectivity. Not enough available connectors to hook up all my Stereo equipment. I opted for a larger Power Amp with enough connectable options to make me happy, & let’s me hook up all my Stereo Equipment. I’ll find another use for this little Power Amp, maybe in my Workshop, I’m just looking for the right Speakers to match up. Shouldn’t be too difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Watson /aka Timbo

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth feature is almost worthless
customer_reviews.text: If you're buying this to be able to stream music from any sort of distance, look elsewhere. The bluetooth receiver, even with the external antenna (that unfortunately can't be removed/extended away from the receiver), has worse range than any bluetooth speaker I've ever used. The wireless signal will be blocked by anything, even a human body in between the phone and the receiver separated by 5 feet. I have to leave my phone right next to the receiver to stream music reliably.
customer_reviews.author: JW_ME

customer_reviews.title: Some parts horrible. Some very good.
customer_reviews.text: The LEDs on the front panel are like staring into high beam headlights, so you are blinded when you want to see controls. I finally used black stickers to block them. FM reception is just decent, but tuning is a total bust. The user manual is a bad joke. Bluetooth is very good, tone is good. Learn to live with some of the nearly fatal defects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product so I would not need a receiver to connect external speakers to the tv. The first product appeared used and did not work as expected. I returned an purchased another and am pleased with this one. At times I will need to unplug from the tv to get the the sound to work and I am unsure why that happens but overall a decent product and does what I wanted it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer2006

customer_reviews.title: I was a Pyle Pro devotee for many purchases
customer_reviews.text: This will likely be the last Pyle Pro Product I buy. I have had it for over a year now and still have difficulty getting it to work to just play music. The Bluetooth range is about 5' and just waving your hand between the source and the receiver causes it to loose connection. I have a $7 Bluetooth device connected to the Aux in which gives me 40' feet and does not lose connection. Do not buy this for its Bluetooth it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: electriac

customer_reviews.title: This small receiver is pretty darn good, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this and are using it to play Bluetooth with Sirius Radio as well as FM radio stations. I have to say that we were not expecting great things but we were pleasantly surprised. WOW what a sound from this thing, it is just amazing. I have it hooked up to some old BOSE bookshelf speakers and this thing handles it quite nicely. If you are looking at this and are on the fence about purchasing it, then do yourself a favor and buy it, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth capability is great, and had not thought about putting music on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for use in my storage building beside the outdoor in ground pool. We open the doors and have some outdoor speakers mounted that swivel towards the pool. The price was right for this application and the item fits my needs exactly. Bluetooth capability is great, and had not thought about putting music on a USB drive but might try that. We mostly listen to Pandora or FM radio while lounging by the pool. Only thing I wish hit had was FM presets but we will get by. It found over 40 FM channels, some not so good reception but it found all the good ones.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Product better than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put in my office to be able to listen to music and podcasts. I first looked at used receivers online and the price of used equipment was similar to this Pyle. I took the change and ordered this, even though I could not believe the low price. I have been more than satisfied. The four star rating for the volume control is that it goes from very low to loud in a short turn, could be more adjustable but that is not really a problem. I highly recommend this product based on my experience to date.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Yoho

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: The good: It's cheap and seems to work ok. But you can't just go up to it and turn the radio station, you have to use their cheap little remote. Not sure what you're supposed to do when the remote goes bad. I guess you get what you pay for but beside not being able to change stations without the remote, it's an ok radio/stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: pumps out some sound through the speakers i bought. ...
customer_reviews.text: update...had to dock a couple stars for quality. The left channel went out, right still works fine. I confirmed by flip flopping speakers and testing with a multimeter...there's nothing coming off one of the speaker outputs. Worked for about 1 year, didn't get much use since we only use it in the summer but...oh well. pumps out some sound through the speakers i bought. use it by the pool with an airplay receiver and it will keep us partying all day long.
customer_reviews.author: ahornATX

customer_reviews.title: Is as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this is supposed to be an "outdoor" receiver; I bought it to replace an outdoor one that I had that finally went down. It's in my garage with my Bose outdoor speakers connected to it. I was outside the other day doing some yard work and I'm satisfied! ...also I love that you can Bluetooth your phone or tablet and not have to worry about an AUX cord to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepy RT

customer_reviews.title: sounds good but controls aren't intuitive
customer_reviews.text: I don't like how the controls operate this device. There is an input selector and another "mode" button. Both have to be selected to bluetooth for that bluetooth devices to connect. Also the volume control only maxes to what the analog roller is set to, meaning you can't get full volume unless the roller is set to 100%. The sound is clean and loud which is nice though. For 75 bucks not a bad buy to hook up phone, turn table etc. and power passive speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Humanfactor

customer_reviews.title: BIG SOUND in a compact design
customer_reviews.text: After years of dealing with an amplifier that would cut out frequently when adjusting the master volume, I decided to shop for a new one. A friend of mine had purchased a Pyle amp and even though I wasn't familiar with the brand I was impressed with sound quality. I have a pair of vintage Nova 10 speakers that sound absolutely amazing as long as the amp is able to power those bad boys. Not only does the PDA6BU have enough power but I rarely go above 3 on the volume control! After just 4 days of use I'm sold on the Pyle brand and would highly recommend this amp to any fellow audiophile.
customer_reviews.author: Edward B.

customer_reviews.title: Typical Instructions.. Radio SCAN Feature
customer_reviews.text: Got it, hooked it up and connected it to my Raspberry Pi, worked GREAT! Went to change to the radio, and spent 1 hour trying to figure out why all i was getting was 88.0.... I had NOT attached the antenna to begin with because I wanted to use it with the Raspberry Pi at first. The instructions are useless; They don't even mention the RADIO FEATURE. Answer - the Play/Pause button will tell the radio scan the channels again, saving any station it finds to one of it's 30 available presets. Then use the fast forward / rewind buttons to skip through the saved channels. Clunky, but it works...finally.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Coggin

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat at this price point!
customer_reviews.text: The first unit I received would not show up on my Bluetooth list of devices, so I quickly received another that has worked perfectly. The unit is compact in size with several connectivity options. I paired this with a speaker selector for a low budget but great option for whole home audio (see picture). The bluetooth range is about average, not super far. It is also plenty loud. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Khary

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is not working good.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is harsh. I don’t know it’s not worm or smooth. I had Yamaha receiver that died after 24 years. Compared to that sound quality is un acceptable to me. It’s not bad for price it’s loud bass is there but you can’t hear for prolonged time. I am sorry if I offended anyone, but if you want to listen to music for long time this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Revised Inexpensive Bluetooth connector to my amp
customer_reviews.text: My specific purpose was to use my Bluetooth in my IPhone to link to this unit. This unit connects to my garage amplifier so I can run my phone,tunes over 4 speakers run by an amplifier that does not have Bluetooth. Works, and it was cheap.its pretty small unit, which is not an issue, I do agree blue tooth range is very low. Maybe 20’
customer_reviews.author: ChiDi

customer_reviews.title: Melted down 10 seconds after plugging it in
customer_reviews.text: Unit started smoking immediately after plugging it in. I have exchanged for an identical unit. I'll update this post after the exchange unit arrives. Update 7/12 - Replacement unit is working. Features are nice and sound is ok but Bluetooth is a disaster. Bluetooth was one of the main reason I bought this unit however Bluetooth reception is terrible. I have it linked to an Echo less than 10 feet away with a direct line of site but connection fails frequently. I have attempted Bluetooth connections with other devices, cell phone, etc. and the results are the same. Bluetooth reception is so bad I might buy a third party Bluetooth unit and use that to connect the tuner to devices.
customer_reviews.author: Gofast321

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Use it in my shop with speakers from an old surround system. Have TV hooked to it and I shoot misic from my phone through Bluetooth. Everything works well. Bluetooth reception a little off at time, especially if I’m moving around with phone. Switched to iPad and leaving it in one space helps. Inputs are only RCA. Was not a problem until I went to hook the new tv up. Tv only had digital optical output. Had to get converter in between. For the price it’s a great product
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E Rosenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Not as capable as it is shown in the pictures
customer_reviews.text: Pictures only show front side of product and insets of connection capability located on the backside. Clearly shows a USB/PC input and AWG speaker wire connect capability which it does not have. Noticed after purchase that even though it is shown that it can in the pictures it is not listed in the discription. Product was returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Scott

customer_reviews.title: The sound is pretty good for something in this price range
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly simple amp - nothing fancy or high quality. We have been using it with a record player for a few months now with no issues. The sound is pretty good for something in this price range. It can sometimes sound a little "empty" but it's nothing that interferes with the experience of the music. Perfect for a temporary set up or until you can afford a higher quality amp!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Second Try - NO SOUND OUT FROM EVERY INPORT SOURCE out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This was the second try with Pyle - Fist one was defective out of the box as well. NO SOUND! Not even a buzz on the speakers. (Tried two different sets both of which worked will other equipment) Quality control is at the least suspect. I'm sorry to say that I can not recommend this product. Save frustration and time and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this for Bluetooth Connecticity
customer_reviews.text: For the basic functionality and price, this works. Admittedly, I am not a fan of Pyle, but I’ll give credit where it’s due. Positives - it works! Has decent power, is a small form factor. Negatives - Bluetooth - not usable. ( unless your within 5 feet ) - arrived with dents in back of unit. Nearly returned it initially, but our son wanted so badly to see it work we plugged it in and it did. So it is used with a 30’ aux cable to his music device as opposed to Bluetooth. Hard to believe it is that bad, but it is.
customer_reviews.author: Humshark

customer_reviews.title: Want my remote???
customer_reviews.text: Pic is the size compared to pen. It was supposed to come with remote but I got NO remote. Thats why I bought for remote. Took 3 weeks to get. I have to but a FM antenna so not sure if works. I like the blue lights on it and very compact. Which is another reason I bought this. Bluetooth connects right away. Not totally disappointed but I am half happy
customer_reviews.author: Charlee

customer_reviews.title: Powerful amp with built in Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: I needed to acquire a new amp to power my jukebox. I thought I would have to uses a add on Bluetooth receiver but this unit has Bluetooth built in. It is very powerful and excellent sound quality even with a old 16 ohm speaker system. Many inputs for different sources and wireless remote control. I am very pleased with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: B Cook

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is excellent the size is very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered three of these receivers already. Sound quality is excellent. It programs the stations and they play clearly. Bluetooth whether it be iPhone TV or tablet connects quick and easy. What I really like is the size very compact. I have them in two of my bedrooms and one in my living room. Ordering the same item 3 times tells you what I think about it.
customer_reviews.author: Fay E. Penn

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little receiver. Bluetooth works great and the features are good in terms of sound adjustment and number on inputs. The LED light on the front is very bright, but a small piece of electrical tape covered it up and is barely noticeable. The volume adjustment seems to be weighted towards the low end, where a small turn of the knob results in a large volume increase. Again, still a great value and sounds nice.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ernst

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This was the second identical Pyle amplifier that I ordered. The first one was returned because there was no sound output on the left channel. I returned it and got a replacement. This second one heats up so hot that you cannot touch it after about 30 minutes, even with proper ventilation all around it. It also emits an electrical wiring burning smell. I think it is dangerous, and could easily cause a fire.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyDoodle

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth and other features were not good
customer_reviews.text: Blue tooth had a VERY limited range..about 10 feet and it needed line of sight. My other blue tooth devices in the same house work everywhere, inside and out. The FM radio required that you scan for the stations everytime you turn it on. It doesn't remember the last station you had on. I could not locate any presets for the radio either. It is flimsy and did not sit flat on the desk. Fortunately I was able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde B

customer_reviews.title: No Volume Control with remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote control does not control the volume on the PYLE PDA6BU, which makes it nearly useless for the application that I purchased it for. I even returned the first one but the second one is just the same. This is a great little amplifier, but this design flaw is very frustrating, especially considering the fact that there is just no reason for this function and flaw to have been missed.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Barely Lasted Two Months
customer_reviews.text: Was initially happy. First the circle LED on the volume button went out, then a background buzz was present all the time on all inputs without anything plugged in to them. Now sounds like complete garbage with any volume above about 30%. Tried multiple speakers and devices, definitely this unit. Bought Apr 4th, today is June 22nd.
customer_reviews.author: S. White

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Received this unit and noticed right away that the sound was not clear. I ran two speakers with it and if I got it to a decent volume the unit would turn off. At first I thought it might be the speakers but they worked on my old unit. Also, the Bluetooth is terrible. Anything further than 15ft and you can kiss the connection goodbye! Called customer service and they were not helpful at all. Ordered a Yamaha unit and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Omer Habul

customer_reviews.title: Great little amp
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device. So far so good. I got this amp in order to power my outside speakers and it does a great job. Very powerful. I love all the different inputs especially the FM tuner and Bluetooth functions. Getting my phone hooked to Bluetooth was very simple and quick. I've only had it about a month but so far no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gautreaux

customer_reviews.title: I like a good bargain and this little dude gives me ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing has its foibles...the reverb effect for the vocal input is way too 'wet', the blue led is bright enough to illuminate a room, and the remote is a total joke. But, I like a good bargain and this little dude gives me a great way to connect our home entertainment speakers to our TV and CD player, PLUS I can do awesome karaoke parties in our living room with a wired mic. Bluetooth works, I plan on adding a BT turntable to the this guy as well. It's a good value for the money, and the small size is cool.
customer_reviews.author: Nick R

customer_reviews.title: Love the small size
customer_reviews.text: I really love the compact size of the PDA6BU . The power output of 200 watts is really incredible for such a small unit. A lot of features have been squeezed into the unit. It has aux, cd, dvd, and MP3 , USB, SD MMC, and an FM tuner. Also the remote control is really a bonus. Two mic inputs are also included. Bluetooth for Wireless Music Streaming is also included. I wish it had an AM tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Mainbabes

customer_reviews.title: this is an OK amp
customer_reviews.text: I used this for one season and this is what i had issue with. Bluetooth connectivity is about 30 feet but it doenst matter how close you are it still cuts out. the remote control does not operate all functions. the sound quality is not the beset but not al bad. at 3/4 volume and below the Bose speakers i have connected sound great. anything above that its distorted. the bose speakers go much louder and clearer when plugged into other amps.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I was a bit surprised with this unit. At its price point I really didn't expect much but I was pleasantly surprised. It was a breeze to set it up and the sound quality is impressive. The bluetooth and usb features work fine which were two of my key criteria for purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: A great unit at this price
customer_reviews.text: This receiver has a lot of features for a unit in this price range. With a variety of inputs and output rated at 100W per channel, it has every thing I could have wanted. The only thing I don't like is that the power button on the remote control does not actually turn the unit off. the unit must still be turned on and off manually. Just don't mount it out of reach.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Just upsetting.
customer_reviews.text: So upset with the product. We’ve been using this in our store daily since June, but this last week it has been slowly dying until today, it finally died. It would constantly drop the Bluetooth connection even when it was working. Now it won’t even show anything on the monitor and I can’t connect anything via Bluetooth at all. If it was just the monitor broken, I could still use it but the whole thing is broken. Just upsetting, I need to use it for a store, daily. Now I need to find a new one and quick
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise
customer_reviews.text: Just got the amp. It replaced an old amp that was in my practice studio which had given up the ghost. Easy to set up. Bluetooth worked as advertised and the thumb drive port on the front is really handy. Put my drive with jazz backgrounds in and was really pleased with the quality of the sound. I should say I was surprised! Plenty of power and a good clean sound overall. Had to turn the bass down a bit. For the money you would be pressed to beat this little amp. We will see how it holds up. The remote works well with the thumb drive and overall.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Helms

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth connectivity is about 5-10 feet away from receiver; otherwise it works well. Try getting their indoor/outdoor speakers and together they work perfectly. The sound is just right for my use. No loud music permitted, but seems with this system I can raise the volume and the neighbor doesn’t seem to be bothered. He would tell me if it did.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't trust this thing for anything
customer_reviews.text: DOA. Both left and right speaker outputs would not produce any sound. In addition, the Mic line in did not work either. The reason how I know that is because I hooked up an audio system on the line output and it didn't work. Sound would come out of the line output of the audio system I piggy backed off of but not from the Pyle receiver. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Gokool Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great little receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great little receiver, once I got it hooked up and running, works great. Had some problems hooking it up, not a problem with the receiver, but the application I'm using it for. Emailed support at Pyle and since then have received 20 emails, although my problem was solved and I informed them of it. I also received a remote that doesn't work. I was promised a replacement under their warranty program, but still waiting for it, 5 weeks and still haven't receiver it, although they keep promising it will come.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Clipsham

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good, some components a little on the substandard side.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars but one of the audio input rca plugs came out when I removed the audio cable. It was not getting sound to one channel so I was going to change cables. So now I am down to just 2 audio inputs. I don't know of a place locally to take this to be fixed. The Bluetooth works good, the sound is good when both channels work. Just be careful when you attach or remove audio cables to the back of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R Pell

customer_reviews.title: Remote control does not work
customer_reviews.text: Remote is supposed to interface with the unit to control volume, power, etc. The remote signal is received by the unit as the requested function is acknowledged on the unit’s display; but the functionality requested does not actuate. Contacted the manufacture; yet to receive any response from them. The unit functions correctly without the remote using the manual controls and the produced amplified sound is relatively decent.
customer_reviews.author: lsnoparts

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and lots of options.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality and easy to use. I could even explain how to use it to some luddite parents who were quite pleased with it as an X-mas gift. It's heavy and seems to have a very nice power supply. The biggest negatives are that it has a number of redundancies that can be confusing to those less technologically minded. But still doable. And the On;Off (laser) LED that is so bright it could cause you to be arrested if you took the unit outside and aimed it at an airplane.
customer_reviews.author: NMH

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The thing is pretty well made and functions okay - but is strange in the manner of switching from one function to another. The Input Selector knob is small and hard to turn, perhaps if they were knurled it would be better. If you only use it to play one item, CD player, USB or IPod it's fine. The FM tuner is also weird. But it works and seems to fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: professional retiree

customer_reviews.title: Works well... very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I evaluated a few of these smaller amplifiers for my application. I like that this unit has twist on (Banana Plugs) terminal connectors for speakers and not spring loaded (pinch type). I like the sound quality with my outdoor speakers and at an affordable price. I was able to use Bluetooth and the range was about 20'. I've moved away from the Bluetooth setup and I am using an Echo Dot with Alexa now which works much better for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: HRH

customer_reviews.title: For the money it is good. Two annoying issues is no way to preset ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money it is good. Two annoying issues is no way to preset certain FM stations and remote volume control is % of volume knob setting. It powers up at the knob volume control setting so be careful of setting the knob too high and backing volume down by remote control during use or you will be blasted when you power it back up. Power switch totally powers off including remote control access. Plays MP3 and WMA good from SD or USB stick.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Amp fried in 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok from start...bought end on Feb... Used infrequently. Maybe 3 times/week for about an hr each time. Used during work out sessions. Unit fried after 7 months. Not worth repairing. Will replace with a better unit. Bluetooth connectivity was lousy and would "clip" at times as well. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Average User

customer_reviews.title: Great solution and great price!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that could power my speakers in my garage/shed, and had bluetooth for connecting my phone/music. I got that, plus FM tuner, plus mic inputs to run a powered mic through for music practice! It doesn't sound like a Macintosh but at this price point I'm pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: decent receiver for the price with BAD instructions
customer_reviews.text: the unit is fine. the instructions are TERRIBLE. Had to email them to find out how to set the FM radio stations. There is absolutely NO indication of how to do it in the "manual". Otherwise, It's fine. the bluetooth range is about 10 feet (going thru a wall) but that's all I need. For the price, it is just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: No One Ever

customer_reviews.title: Unit No longer Transmits Sound after Several Months of Purchase
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the amp it arrived with a few dents on front and back portion. I had not paid any attention to the cosmetics of the unit due to the amp was working fine and I had no plans on returning it. After several months of usage the amp suddenly stopped transmitting sound. Whats odd is that the display panel and blue tooth connectivity works fine but the power led light and volume light does not work and as a result ithe unit is not transmitting any sound. Its a shame that I now see in the comments many customers complaining about the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised at the quality of this product. Very powerful. I only need to crank it up to the 25 percent level. Sound is good to very good. Size is compact, not too big. Solid build. Plays wav files. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the price, can’t go wrong!! FM crystal clear. Bluetooth connected without problems I’m running some bookshelf speakers and record player thru it. Sounds really good and can get loooooud! Also has 1/4 inch input jack for a mic. I play my guitar thru it when I wanna Jam when I dont want to set up my guitar amp.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Spirit

customer_reviews.title: a little dissapointed, but still a good product
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a little more. The battery in the remote was no good , so i was unable to use the control for radio, etc manually with the knobs. it was / still is a bit confusing to use. the treble and the base are not at all what i had hoped for. the bluetooth works excellent and paired easily with my phone. like the blue light that shines brightly when power is on.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: Compact and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This works really well in my dad’s manufacturing shop. We added his XM radio to and now he has all kinds of choices with great sound. We had older speakers that I worried might need to be replaced, but this unit made them sound better than ever. It’s a great size, and gives us lots of options if he wants them.
customer_reviews.author: Staci Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Surprising
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good little receiver for the money. I needed something to hook up some blue tooth speakers to for the patio. and this worked great. I can control all the music from my phone. It looks pretty nice too. lots of features you would expect only in a higher end receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Memories
